original: DAHLMAN, Paul K un e Edward, Konsul, Örebro, f Sthlm 18/6 84 av rektor A D o Alfrida Wiedesheim-Paul, gm Molly Hwass. H a l, tekn gymn Örebro 1905, resoffex 08, Scrantons univ USA 10—11. Ljtn Livreg.gren res. Anst i väg- o vät.byggn.branschen 05—13, i Sthlms stds tjst v Tranebergsbrons bygg 14, Stat Vat.fallsverk, linjebyggn, 14—22, vkst dir o Styr.led D J Elgérus Fabr- o Hdls AB öbr sed. 22, ens inneh sed. 28, hissinsp öbr std o l sed. 19. Britt v. konsul öbr sed. 34. Ordf Frn Sv:es Skönfärgerier o Kern Tvättanstalter, Styr.led o sekr Sanif öbr stds- o länsbibi vänner, led öbr l distr.styr av Röda Korset, Styr.led Sv Yllekonc Tidan, öbr l Köpm.frb, Beklädn- o Manuf.hdlsfrn, Färgeritekn Riks-frb, Färgerimuseum i Norrkp samt curling- o golf klubbar Resor: USA 09—13, Frankr 01, 25, 31, Engl 01, 09, 24, 31, 34, 36, 39, Ital 30, 32, 33, Tyskl, Österr o Ungern mfl Idr Av trycket: Hissbestämm o instr 23, kulturhist små-tryck o tidn.upps samt div skrifter om ex-libris o böcker, minnesskrifter t fma D J Elgérus 80-, resp 100-årsjub, d:o t Skönfär-garfrns JO- o 25-års^ub mm. PrRKO 23, Sv:esLstfrnrars Centralförbs SM 24, SvRKftjM2kl 42. Hobbies: Kulturvård, böcker o gamla möbler, silver, tenn, koppar. Inneh Sv :es största ex libris-samling. D J Elgérus Fabr o Hdls AB gr 14/6 1843 av färg D J Elgérus i öbr samtidigt som han inköpte det gamla Schenströmska färgeriet där och lancerade »nyaste Färgmethoder». Und sin 100-åriga tillv har fman, som blev Kgl hovlev till sekeljub, haft end två inneh före D. (Litt: Minnesskrifter utg v 80- o 100-årsjub).
translated: DAHLMAN, Paul K un e Edward, Consul, Örebro, b. Stockholm 18/6 84, son of rector A D and Alfrida Wiedesheim-Paul, m. Molly Hwass. H a l, technical gymnastics Örebro 1905, reserve officer 08, Scranton University USA 10-11. Lieutenant Livreg. branch reserve. Employed in road and railway construction industry 05-13, in Stockholm's municipality service at Tranebergsbrons construction site 14, State Vattenfallsverk, line construction 14-22, director and board member D J Elgérus Fabrics and Trading Co. since 22, sole owner since 28, elevator inspector in the city and county since 19. British vice consul in Örebro since 34. Chairman of Frn Sv:es Skönfärgerier and Kern Laundry Facilities, board member and secretary of Sanif in the city and county library friends, board member of Swedish Red Cross local district, board member of the Swedish Wool Concession Tidan, member of the local Merchant Association, Clothing and Manufacturing Trade Association, National Dyeing Technology Association, Dyeing Museum in Norrköping, and curling and golf clubs. Travels: USA 09-13, France 01, 25, 31, England 01, 09, 24, 31, 34, 36, 39, Italy 30, 32, 33, Germany, Austria and Hungary, among others. Published works: Elevator regulations and instructions 23, cultural history small prints and newspaper articles, as well as various writings on ex-libris and books, commemorative writings for D J Elgérus' 80th and 100th anniversaries, and for the Skönfärgarfrn JO and 25-year anniversary, among others. Received PrRKO 23, Svenska städrådets Central Association's SM 24, and Svenska Röda Korsets tjänstemedalj 42. Hobbies: Cultural preservation, books and antique furniture, silver, tin, copper. Owns Sweden's largest ex-libris collection. D J Elgérus Fabrics and Trading Co. founded 14/6 1843 by color maker D J Elgérus in Örebro, at the same time purchasing the old Schenström dye works and launching "the latest coloring methods". Throughout its 100-year history, the company, which became a royal court supplier for its centennial celebrations, had only two owners before D. (Literature: Commemorative writings published for the 80th and 100th anniversaries).
